cheatsheet.title: Create a new catalog overview analysis

intro.description: This type of analysis analyzes one specific catalog in a database and returns information about the catalog content.

item.title: Select a catalog to analyze
item.description: Note that catalog overview analysis is only possible in databases in which catalog entities are part of their physical structure. To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click the Analyses folder on the DQ Repository tree view and select New Analysis. Expand Structural Analysis and select Catalog Overview Analysis(or click the link below). The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description....). Browse to and select a catalog to analyze, and add table or view filters if required. Upon completion an editor opens, in which you can review the analysis settings.

item.title: Review your settings
item.description: You can review and modify your settings, if necessary, in the analysis editor. Click Analysis Parameters to modify the table or view filters in the corresponding fields.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: To execute the analysis, click the Run icon located to the top left of the editor (or click the link below). You can also run an analysis from the Repository tree view. To do so, right click the relevant analysis and click the Run icon on the contextual menu which appears.
